node.title: A judge will decide if the men convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery ever get a chance at parole.
node.description: But under Georgia law, all three men must get sentenced to life in prison.

node.title: NFL, NBA & NHL Thanksgiving Schedule: Full List of Sports to Watch Over the Weekend
node.description: Once you've finished your Thanksgiving traditions, there's dozens of football, hockey and basketball games available to watch on TV this Thanksgiving weekend.

node.title: DOJ Says Alabama Has Yet to Fix Its Prisons Where 33 Inmates Have Died in Last 3 Years
node.description: The United States lawsuit against Alabama claimed the state's prison conditions are so bad they violate the constitution's ban on cruel and unusual punishment.

node.title: Gray Wolf That Trekked 935 Miles From Oregon to California Found Dead Near Roadway
node.description: The first gray wolf to be documented in Southern California since the 1920s was found dead.

node.title: Feds Will Act Swiftly to Prosecute Airline Passengers Who Misbehave, Get Violent
node.description: The FAA has initiated nearly 1,000 investigations into passenger conduct this year, the highest by far since they started keeping track in 1995.

node.title: Massachusetts Lawmakers Approve Bill on Holocaust Education Amid Rise in Antisemitism
node.description: If enacted, a Genocide Education Trust Fund would be made under the bill to help create teaching materials and give training for educators.

node.title: Dem Lawmaker Says 'Buck Stops With the President' on Gas Prices as White House Dodges Blame
node.description: On Tuesday, Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm told reporters, "The president does not control the price of gasoline. No president does."

node.title: Timeline: Chronicling Recent Smash-and-Grab Robberies in LA, Bay Area Amid Crime Spike
node.description: Many of the reported thefts have involved dozens of people who broke into stores and stole items while traveling in groups.

node.title: Meet the man who sold his house to buy a record press
node.description: Neil Wilson is pinning his hopes on the "strong energy" of Brisbane's music scene and music lovers' passion for vinyl as he jumps into the record business.

node.title: 'I'm still stunned': Ancient mammoth tusk found 3km under the sea
node.description: Researchers recover an ancient mammoth tusk, thought to be over 100,000 years old, three kilometres under the sea off the central coast of California.

node.title: 'Recognising infant loss starts in our workplace': Push for paid miscarriage leave for public servants
node.description: Donna Penny has endure two miscarriages and given birth to a stillborn son. Now she is joining growing calls for the ACT government to legislate a paid leave scheme for public servants who experienced miscarriage or stillbirth.

node.title: Tom Hardy's loveable monster returns in a scrappy sequel smart enough to play totally dumb
node.description: The first Venom was panned, but Andy Serkis’s sequel is unapologetically juvenile - with comedic banter, gross-out effects and epic CGI clashes. It’s also surprisingly tender.

node.title: Jetstar pilot held over missing campers case enters third day in custody without charge
node.description: Today marks the third day a Jetstar pilot has been held in custody by authorities without a charge in connection with the disappearance of campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who went missing in Victoria's High Country last year.

node.title: Today is expected to be the peak of what has already been a thoroughly drenching system
node.description: There is still more rain to come for the soggy east coast, but it is finally looking like there could be a bit of a break next week.

node.title: Queensland Premier confirms border bubble being considered amid Byron Bay COVID scare
node.description: Annastacia Palaszczuk says the Queensland government is "looking at that border bubble" for when the state reaches a 80 per cent double vaccination target but a COVID-19 case in Byron Bay needs close consideration.

node.title: Spy bosses step out of the shadows in unprecedented move
node.description: For decades the existence of Australia's overseas spy agency ASIS was officially a secret, and no employee of the covert organisation except for its director-general was allowed to be identified publicly — until now.

node.title: Small business sales rise despite Covid-19 uncertainty and mental toll
node.description: Small businesses are seeing improvements in sales, jobs and waited less time for invoices to be paid.

node.title: Vaccine pass helpline swamped by calls as thousands eye traffic-light travel
node.description: Long waits, cut-offs, and unanswered messages are leaving callers to the Covid-19 vaccine pass helpline helpless.

node.title: Building consent demands cause delays in Dunedin
node.description: The Dunedin City Council is asking for patience as its building services team struggles with a boom in building consents.

node.title: ‘It’s good to see racism lose’: Guilty verdicts are hailed in the Arbery case.
node.description: The murder convictions of three white men in the death of Ahmaud Arbery were praised by many as a just outcome in a case that could have stoked racial divisions.

node.title: The royal family is in a dispute with the BBC. This is why
node.description: The British royal family issues a rare joint statement claiming a BBC documentary titled The Princes and the Press makes "overblown and unfounded claims". Here's why.

node.title: Starring Louise Erdrich as Herself
node.description: In her new best seller, “The Sentence,” the veteran novelist plays a small but important role as her protagonist’s benevolent boss.

node.title: Canned or Fresh Cranberry Sauce? Americans Are Divided
node.description: A new survey suggests that although about one in three Americans do not like cranberry sauce, those who do like the Thanksgiving condiment are divided.

node.title: Critics Say $9B Houston Highway Project Racially Unjust, Will Impact Diverse Neighborhoods
node.description: Increased pollution, displacement, and flooding could trouble Black and Latino residents if the project comes to fruition, critics say.

node.title: What’s in Our Queue? ‘The Show of Shows’ and More
node.description: I'm a senior staff editor on the Culture desk. Here are five things I've been watching, reading and sifting through.

node.title: 'Accountability for Hate': Progressive Politicians React to Guilty Verdict in Ahmaud Arbery Case
node.description: "This guilty verdict is a step toward justice that Ahmaud and his family deserve," California Representative Jimmy Gomez tweeted.

node.title: When Is the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade? 2021 Date, Route and Schedule
node.description: New York City's annual parade will allow in-person viewings this year after being closed to spectators in 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic.

node.title: Indiana Extends COVID State of Emergency After Lawmakers Stall Anti-Mandate Bill
node.description: The bill would require businesses to accept COVID vaccine exemptions, and will no longer be debated on November 29 due to the lack of action.

node.title: Australia Adds U.S.-Based Neo-Nazi Group to List of Banned Terrorist Organizations
node.description: The Base, a neo-nazi group, was formed in the United States in 2018. The Base is the second far-right group to make Australia's list of banned organizations.

node.title: Fed Acknowledges Inflation Greater Than Expected, Plans for Possible Long-Term Effects
node.description: Minutes released Wednesday of the Federal Reserve's November 2-3 meeting revealed officials discussing inflation, and what the central bank could do to help.
